Deep_Breathing.title: Deep Breathing
Deep_Breathing.description: Deep breathing is a simple yet effective technique to help relax the mind and body. It involves taking slow, deep breaths to reduce stress and anxiety.
Deep_Breathing.subTitle: Steps
subDescription: Sit or lie down in a comfortable position.
Close your eyes and take a deep breath in through your nose for a count of four.
Hold your breath for a count of four.
Exhale slowly through your mouth for a count of four.
Repeat this process several times until you feel calm.

Progressive_Muscle_Relaxation.title: Progressive Muscle Relaxation
Progressive_Muscle_Relaxation.description: Progressive Muscle Relaxation (PMR) involves tensing and then slowly relaxing different muscle groups in the body to reduce physical tension and stress.
Progressive_Muscle_Relaxation.subTitle: Steps
subDescription: Find a quiet place to sit or lie down.
Start with your feet and work your way up to your head.
Tense each muscle group for 5-10 seconds and then slowly release.
Focus on the sensation of relaxation in each muscle group.
Repeat if necessary.

Mindfulness_Meditation.title: Mindfulness Meditation
Mindfulness_Meditation.description: Mindfulness meditation involves focusing on the present moment without judgment. It helps increase awareness and acceptance of one's thoughts and feelings.
Mindfulness_Meditation.subTitle: Steps
subDescription: Sit comfortably and close your eyes.
Focus on your breath, noticing the sensation of air entering and leaving your body.
If your mind wanders, gently bring your focus back to your breath.
Continue for 5-10 minutes or longer if desired.

Exercise.title: Exercise
Exercise.description: Physical activity can improve mood, reduce anxiety, and increase overall well-being. Exercise releases endorphins, which are natural mood lifters.
Exercise.subTitle: Suggestions
subDescription: Go for a walk or run.
Join a gym or fitness class.
Practice yoga or stretching exercises.
Engage in sports or physical activities you enjoy.

Journaling.title: Journaling
Journaling.description: Writing down thoughts and feelings can help process emotions and reduce stress. Journaling provides a safe space to express oneself without judgment.
Journaling.subTitle: Steps:
subDescription: Set aside time each day to write.
Write about your thoughts, feelings, and experiences.
Use prompts if needed, such as "What am I grateful for today?" or "What challenges did I face today and how did I overcome them?
Reflect on your entries to gain insights and understanding.

Positive Affirmations.title: Positive Affirmations
Positive Affirmations.description: Positive affirmations are statements that can help challenge and overcome negative thoughts. Repeating affirmations can boost self-esteem and confidence.
Positive Affirmations.subTitle: Examples:
subDescription: "I am strong and capable."
"I can handle anything that comes my way."
"I am worthy of love and respect."
"I believe in myself and my abilities."

Social Support.title: Social Support
Social Support.description: Connecting with friends, family, or support groups can provide emotional comfort and reduce feelings of isolation.
Social Support.subTitle: Suggestions:
subDescription: Reach out to a trusted friend or family member.
Join a support group for individuals with similar experiences.
Participate in community activities or clubs.

Healthy Eating.title: Healthy Eating
Healthy Eating.description: Maintaining a balanced diet can improve overall mental and physical health. Certain foods can help stabilize mood and energy levels.
Healthy Eating.subTitle: Tips:
subDescription: Eat a variety of fruits and vegetables.
Include whole grains and lean proteins in your diet.
Avoid excessive sugar and caffeine.
Stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water.

Sleep Hygiene.title: Sleep Hygiene
Sleep Hygiene.description: Good sleep hygiene involves creating a sleep environment and routine that promotes restful sleep. Adequate sleep is essential for mental health.
Sleep Hygiene.subTitle: Tips:
subDescription: Go to bed and wake up at the same time each day.
Create a relaxing bedtime routine.
Make your sleep environment comfortable and free from distractions.
Avoid screens and caffeine before bedtime.

Creative Activities.title: Creative Activities
Creative Activities.description: Engaging in creative activities like art, music, or writing can be therapeutic and provide an outlet for self-expression.
Creative Activities.subTitle: Suggestions:
subDescription: Try painting, drawing, or crafting.
Play a musical instrument or sing.
Write poetry, stories, or songs.
Explore other creative hobbies that interest you.
